Article Title: Mamata visits BJP MP injured in attack
Article Text: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee Tuesday visited BJP MP Khagen Murmu in a Siliguri hospital's ICU where he was admitted for being injured in an attack, allegedly by Trinamool workers, during his visit to flood-affected areas of Nagrakata, Jalpaiguri.The CM spoke to doctors treating Murmu and met his wife and son . "If you need further treatment elsewhere, please let me know," she told the MP. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has sought a report from Bengal govt within three days on the attack.
Article Summary: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee Tuesday visited BJP MP Khagen Murmu in a Siliguri hospital's ICU. Murmu was injured in an attack, allegedly by Trinamool workers, during his visit to flood-affected areas. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has sought a report from Bengal govt within three days on the attack.

Article Title: Bihar assembly elections: AIMIM fields history-sheeter from Sherghati
Article Text:
File photo: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi

Owaisi Offers Alliance With RJD, Seeks 6 Bihar Seats; Warns Denial Could Benefit BJP

AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday announced the candidature of a history sheeter, also accused of a police officer's murder, as his party's candidate from Sherghati seat in Gaya district in the upcoming polls.Sherghati will vote on Nov 11, the second and last phase of polling in Bihar. Shan Ali, out on bail, is accused of killing an SHO in Gaya in Oct 2016. He faces dozens of cases related to murder and other serious offences. Owaisi hailed Shan Ali as a "crusader against injustice".
Article Summary: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi announced the candidature of a history sheeter, also accused of a police officer's murder. Shan Ali, out on bail, is accused of killing an SHO in Gaya in Oct 2016. He faces dozens of cases related to murder and other serious offences. Sherghati will vote on Nov 11, second and last phase of polling in Bihar.

Article Title: Former PM HD Deve Gowda admitted to Bengaluru hospital due to infection
Article Text:
H D Deve Gowda (PTI file photo)

NEW DELHI: Former prime minister and Rajya Sabha MP HD Deve Goda was hospitalised on Tuesday in Bengaluru due to an infection.The Janta Dal (Secular) leader was admitted to Manipal Hospital at Old Airport Road. "His progress is being monitored by a team of medical experts," the hospital said in a statement.According to family sources, the 92-year-old JD(S) supremo developed a fever and was subsequently admitted to the hospital.More details awaited.
Article Summary: HD Deve Goda was hospitalised on Tuesday in Bengaluru due to an infection. The Janta Dal (Secular) leader was admitted to Manipal Hospital. "His progress is being monitored by a team of medical experts," the hospital said in a statement.
